description:
Miki Koishikawa lived a normal life - until her parents tell her they'll get divorced.. She doesn't agree, until she meets Yuu Matsuura... the handsome son of another couple, with whom her parents are switching spouses. They all live together now in an enormous house, and Miki and Yuu find themselves falling in love. They'll have to struggle with their own feelings, other people who want to be with them, and whatever Lady Luck and Fate throws in their ways...

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Inseki
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations among step, adopted, and other non-blood related family members.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

node.description:
__ Likes:__  Blue, Chocolate, "Practical Magic", Powerpuff Girls, Tennis, Watching soccer games
__Hobbies:__  Bead-based fashion designs, Shopping, Travelling  

Was born as Mari Nakai, or 中井 真里  She graduated with a degree in economics from Hitotsubashi University.  She started her career as a mangaka while working as an office lady.  Known as a social mangaka, she often hangs out with close friends Megumi Mizusawa, Miho Obana, and Ai Yazawa.  Her debut work was in 1984 with a yomikiri (short story) called "Radical Romance" in Ribon Original magazine.  The artist has since produced a string of fan-favorite titles, including Quartet Game, Handsome na Kanojo (Handsome Girl), Marmalade Boy, and Random Walk.  Many of her titles are available throughout Europe and Asia.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimou730) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/馬越嘉彦)

A highly prolific and respected character designer.

Originating from Monsieur Onion, where he spent his in-betweening days studying under [Hirotoshi Takaya](https://anilist.co/staff/117473/) and [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/). In 1991, he moved to Studio Cockpit with [Hisashi Kagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120432/) and [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/). A few years later he debuted as a character designer on [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/anime/1859/) in 1994.

He is said to be a very fast and efficient worker, and according to himself, he much rather participates in TV productions than theatrical ones. Close friends with [Hiroshi Nagahama](https://anilist.co/staff/99346/) whom he often works with. They first worked together on [Juubei-chan 2](https://anilist.co/anime/636/), for which Umakoshi provided the designs for and served as the chief animation director on all 13 episodes. The following year, the duo teamed up again for [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), which's production quality was unusually high for a TV production. Umakoshi designed the characters and worked as the chief animation director on all 26 episodes of the series and hit a burn-out. After this he took a step back on major roles for a few years. Both him and Nagahama reprised their roles on Mushishi's revival in 2014.

In 2016, Umakoshi was appointed as the character designer on [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/), and has since been highly involved with the series' production as both an animation director and animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.

[Website](https://or-lab.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/k1oku)

Graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music.

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - I WANT TO FALL IN LOVE. HE'S COOL BUT I CAN'T FORGIVE HIM.
Episode 2 - KISS SEQUELA. I CAN'T UNDERSTAND HIM.
Episode 3 - TWO KISSES. YU HAS A LOVER.
Episode 4 - GINTA'S CONFESSION. "YOU ARE MINE, NOT HIM."
Episode 5 - THE LEGEND OF LOVE WISH TO MEDAIYU.
Episode 6 - I HATE GINTA!!
Episode 7 - "ROMANCE IN HOKKAIDO" WHAT'S HAPPENED TO TWO?
Episode 8 - THE FRAGRANCE OF AN GROWN-UP. "I AM NOT JEALOUS."
Episode 9 - PART-TIME JOB: "THE MATCH OF LOVE IS JUDGED BY SALES"
Episode 10 - FIRST NIGHT. A SURPRISE IN THE BATH ROOM.
Episode 11 - YOU ARE GAZING AT ME.
Episode 12 - "SMASH! I LIKE BOTH YU AND GINTA."
Episode 13 - LOVE AND FRIENDSHIP: GINTA, PLEASE GO AROUND ARIMI.
Episode 14 - BE QUALIFIED TO BE IN LOVE.  YOU ARE NOT GOOD ENOUGH FOR YOU.
Episode 15 - MEIKO'S SECRET.  I WANTED YOU TO TELL ME…
Episode 16 - DECISION OF A MAN, NAMURA NEVER GIVES UP!
Episode 17 - MEIKO: "I CAN'T SAY GOOD-BYE!!
Episode 18 - LOVE'S WHEREABOUTS: IT'S WON'T TURN OUT AS YOU WISH.
Episode 19 - TROUBLE OF REGISTRATION OF MARRIAGE. DON'T TELL ME IT IS RUDE!
Episode 20 - SUSPICIOUS TWO. YU AND MIWA ARE A COUPLE?
Episode 21 - TIP TO KARUIZAWA. "SOMETHING… STRANGE!"
Episode 22 - DOUBLE DATING. "CAN'T UNDERSTAND EACH OTHER, EVEN WE ARE IN LOVE."
Episode 23 - A IMPACT CANFESSION. "YU, WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT ?"
Episode 24 - THE SECRET OF HIS BIRTH. "I CAN'T LEAVE YU ALONE."
Episode 25 - REAL KISS. "I LOVE YU."
Episode 26 - THE NEW ANXIETY. "I'M AFRAID… I'M TOO HAPPY."
Episode 27 - HOW LONG WILL THIS HAPPINESS GO ON?
Episode 28 - WAVERED HEART.  I'M GOING TO WORK TOO!
Episode 29 - NUISANCE OF LOVE. "CAN'T FIND OUT THE MEDAIYU."
Episode 30 - "RIVAL. I LOVE YU SO MUCH."
Episode 31 - SUZU AND HOTARU. "TWO MAKE THEM ANXIOUS."
Episode 32 - THE LOVE AT THE CAMPUS FESTIVAL. "YU AND HOTARU'S CONCERT."
Episode 33 - LOVE'S TURNING POINT. "I LOVE YOU."
Episode 34 - A PREMONITION OF PARTING. "A HALLOWEEN PARTY SCHEME."
Episode 35 - PASSING EACH OTHER. "DOES THIS MEAN TO PART WITH ME?"
Episode 36 - ALL ALONE. "I'LL BE THE ONE TO MAKE YOU FORGET."
Episode 37 - A SAD RECOUNTER. "TO THINK I GOT OVER IT."
Episode 38 - ANJU'S FEELING. "I ONLY WANT TO BE SECOND."
Episode 39 - SAD LOVE. I LOVE YU FOR SURE!
Episode 40 - HOLY HIGHT. "I AM ALONE EVEN IT'S CHRISTMAS EVE."
Episode 41 - LOVER'S MORNING. "MERRY CHRISTMAS."
Episode 42 - THE LOVE PATTERN OF THE NEW YEAR. "IT MAY BE A GREAT YEAR."
Episode 43 - THE SKY TRIP. "I DON'T LEAVE YOU TWO ALONE."
Episode 44 - FUTURE OF TWO. "YU'S DREAM. WHAT'S ABOUT MY DREAM?"
Episode 45 - MEIKO TREMBLING. "I'LL GO TO HIROSHIMA."
Episode 46 - "TO HIROSHIMA… "
Episode 47 - AT THE BEACH SIDE. "THINKING OF YOUR HAPPINESS."
Episode 48 - "SWEET AND BITTER ST. VALENTINE'S DAY."
Episode 49 - IT'S HARD TO BE HAPPY."
Episode 50 - AN EXCHANGE STUDENT ARRIVES!! "MICHAEL IS WIRED."
Episode 51 - THE TRIANGULAR LOVE, "MY LIFE IS UPSET… "
Episode 52 - THE DECISION IN A MOONLIGHT. "YU… I DON'T WANT TO BE SEPARATED !"
Episode 53 - MAKING MEMORIES. "WHATEVER HAPPENS, I WON'T REGRET."
Episode 54 - NEW LIFE. "WHAT'S YU DOING RIGHT NOW?"
Episode 55 - A RIPPLE AGAIN. "NEW YORK IS TOO FAR."
Episode 56 - A MISUNDERSTANDING. "MY BOYFRIEND IS YU."
Episode 57 - LOSING LOVE WAY. "I CAN'T STAND IT! I'M SO LONELY."
Episode 58 - A TONE OF CONFESSION. "I WANT YOU TO LOOK AT ME AS A MAN."
Episode 59 - ANXIOUS WEEKEND. "I WANT TO HEAR YU'S VOICE."
Episode 60 - LOVER SI REALLY FAR AWAY. "YU IS IN FRONT OF ME."
Episode 61 - TRAP IN NEW YORK. "YU, AM I STUPID?"
Episode 62 - GOOD-BYE. "I CAN'T BE YOUR GIRLFRIEND ANYMORE."
Episode 63 - HOLDING TEARS. "I WANT TO BE ALONE NOW."
Episode 64 - THE PROBLEM BETWEEN YU AND MIKI. "I WANT TO HEAR YOUR VOICE."
Episode 65 - THE FIRM DETERMINATION. "I'LL TAKE… MIKI."
Episode 66 - THE NEW CHOICE. "YOU DON'T HAVE TO FORGET ABOUT HIM."
Episode 67 - FRIENDS. "I NEED HOTARU."
Episode 68 - RELATIONSHIP BECOMES UNSTEADY. "GOOD-BYE, GINTA."
Episode 69 - THE POWER OF LOVE. "I'VE MADE UP MY MIND."
Episode 70 - HELLO AGAIN. "HOW SHOULD I SEE HIM AGAIN?"
Episode 71 - NIGHT BETWEEN STAR AND MOON. "LONELY, EVEN IF YOU ARE NEW."
Episode 72 - A HALF BROTHER AND SISTER. "HAPPINESS S COLLAPSED."
Episode 73 - PARTING. "THIS WAS THE ONLY WAY."
Episode 74 - A MEMORY BOX. "GOOD-BYE, YU."
Episode 75 - "BROTHER AND SISTER?!  WE MUST BREAK UP."
Episode 76 - START ON A JOURNEY, AND LOVE GOES ON."
